newsitem.title: USA: Ultradata to cut workforce by 50 people.
newsitem.headline: Ultradata to cut workforce by 50 people.

text.p: Ultradata said on Tuesday it was reducing its workforce to approximately 225 people from 275 and reallocating resources to reduce administrative overheads while focusing on its client-server product lines.
"We had a cost structure that was too dependent on new account growth," Robert Majteles, president, said.
It said it also aimed to focus on product standardization and customer support.

"We are excited about the steps being taken to improve the quality of products and services we deliver to our customers. We intend to add new customers on a controlled basis, ensuring that our customers receive the excellent support and service they deserve," Majteles said.
Ultradata provides online information management solutions for financial institutions.
